definition: to send word/to deliver a letter
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: The messenger bent and scratched at his knee where the strapping chafed.
sentences.chinese: 送信人弯下腰来，挠着膝部被绑腿磨红的地方。

sentences.english: I have obtained the favour that the bearer has a short note from Charles to his wife.
sentences.chinese: 已蒙批准让送信人给查尔斯之妻带去一便条。

sentences.english: A:He has to deliver letters every day.
This might involve going on a long journey or sending a communication by messenger.
sentences.chinese: 与人交流很可能需要长途跋涉，或派使者送信。

sentences.english: Not unlike the client, the server can send information through header fields.
sentences.chinese: 与客户机不同，服务器可以通过头字段发送信息。

sentences.english: A postman delivers mail three times a day. But he brought no letter yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 邮差一天送信三次，可是昨天没有带信来。

sentences.english: The Help Experience Improvement Program also collects and sends information to Microsoft.
sentences.chinese: 帮助体验改善计划也会搜集和发送信息到微软。

sentences.english: When you have a post-office box , postman will not bring letters to you .
sentences.chinese: 当你有了一个邮箱时，邮递员就不会再给你送信来了。

sentences.english: I walked the length of the rued'Antin without coming across any sort of messenger.
sentences.chinese: 我经过昂坦街，却没有碰到一个送信人。

sentences.english: It delivered the mail faster than stagecoaches.
sentences.chinese: 它送信的速度比公共马车快。

sentences.english: To you; and which I discovered in the pocket-book of the messenger.
sentences.chinese: 是给您的，我是在那送信人的笔记本里发现的。

sentences.english: You have unsent messages, do you wish to quit anyway?
sentences.chinese: 您有未发送信息，您仍然想要退出吗？

sentences.english: For people in my letter, I saw the weather gets cloudy.
sentences.chinese: 在我为人们送信时，我看到天气变阴了。

sentences.english: Eighty percent of Jiayuan's revenue now comes from paid messaging.
sentences.chinese: 目前公司八成的收入来自付费发送信息服务。

sentences.english: Don't shoot the messenger, but things will go wrong and you will screw up.
sentences.chinese: 不要迁怒于送信者，事情将出错，你会搞砸的。

sentences.english: I do not suffer from the trip of the life, I am just a courier .
sentences.chinese: 我并不害怕人生苦旅，因为我就是一个送信的人。

definition: to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to take a letter/to send word
to reply/to write back/letter written in reply/CL:封[feng1]
intelligence gatherer/spy/detective/scout/sound (medical instrument)/long and narrow probing and sampling utensil
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
